content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Sure, here is an example of how you can implement this:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
   print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```
This `show` method takes two arguments: an IO object and a FloatWithUnits object. It then prints out the value and unit of the struct by calling the `print` function with the formatted string as its argument.
